examples: The conference organizers requested that all presenters submit an abstract of their research papers.
You know I never make requests like this, cut me some slack.
You know I never make requests like this, cut me a break.
I'm hot on the heels of the suspect, requesting immediate backup.
In the past they've tended to turn a deaf ear to such requests.
words.defineEn: to ask for something politely or formally
words.defineVi: để yêu cầu một cái gì đó một cách lịch sự hoặc chính thức

examples: The question requires critical thinking and analysis.
The slow healing process of the wound required regular care.
Harvesting abalone for culinary purposes requires sustainable practices to ensure the long-term survival of it.
The passport application requires you to fill in your first name, middle name, and last name.
Pupils are required to sit nine subjects at GCSE.
words.defineEn: to need or demand something as necessary in a particular situation
words.defineVi: cần hoặc yêu cầu một cái gì đó khi cần thiết trong một tình huống cụ thể

examples: The revised edition is to all intents and purposes a new book.
The scientist had to eat crow and revise their theory after new evidence contradicted their original findings.
The changes to the project didn't sit well with the team, so they decided to revise the plan.
Mark wasn't happy with his first draft of the book, but he's grateful for the chance to take a second bite at the cherry and revise it before submitting it to publishers.
The writing instructor told the students that whoever writes a book should be ready to accept criticism, and encouraged them to revise their work based on feedback from others.
words.defineEn: to make changes to something because of new information, etc.
words.defineVi: để thay đổi một cái gì đó vì thông tin mới, vv

examples: This business method takes the risk of failure out of the table.
Adults were also at risk from epidemics.
Any investment involves an element of risk.
All personal belongings are left at the owner’s risk.
He risked his life to save his daughter from the fire.
words.defineEn: to put something important in a situation where it could be harmed, lost, or destroyed
words.defineVi: để đặt một cái gì đó quan trọng trong một tình huống mà nó có thể bị tổn hại, bị mất hoặc bị phá hủy

examples: Roll cellophane noodles, veggies, and shrimp in rice paper for tasty summer rolls.
Heads are rolling all over the place.
Heads will have to roll at board level.
When the boss finds out about the mistake, heads will roll.
I rolled the dice on a tool brand I haven't used before.
words.defineEn: to make something move by turning it over and over or from side to side repeatedly
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó di chuyển bằng cách lật nó qua lại hoặc từ bên này sang bên kia nhiều lần

examples: Roll cellophane noodles, veggies, and shrimp in rice paper for tasty summer rolls.
Heads are rolling all over the place.
Heads will have to roll at board level.
When the boss finds out about the mistake, heads will roll.
I rolled the dice on a tool brand I haven't used before.
words.defineEn: to move in a direction by turning over and over or from one side to another repeatedly
words.defineVi: di chuyển theo một hướng bằng cách quay đi quay lại hoặc từ bên này sang bên kia nhiều lần

examples: The flight attendant scanned my electronic ticket before I boarded the plane.
He works as a cashier at the supermarket, scanning and bagging customers' items.
An MRI machine scans his or her head.
Scan the ROG totem.
Scan the QR code on the back of your thermostat.
words.defineEn: to quickly read a document or other text without paying attention to details, only to find the information one needs
words.defineVi: để đọc nhanh một tài liệu hoặc văn bản khác mà không chú ý đến chi tiết, chỉ để tìm thông tin cần thiết

examples: They're separating.
He separated the wheat from the chaff in hopes of improving productivity.
The closet had a separate section for hanging long garments like coats and dresses.
With a knife, he separated the endosperm from the seed, revealing its starchy and nutrient-rich composition.
They peeled and separated the orange segments to make a fruit salad.
words.defineEn: to divide or disconnect something from a larger whole
words.defineVi: để phân chia hoặc ngắt kết nối một cái gì đó từ một tổng thể lớn hơn

examples: That DJ's voice really sets my teeth on edge.
The surgeon set her broken arm.
The scheme sets a precedent for other companies.
International companies set the price of oil.
His time in the 25-meter freestyle set a national record.
words.defineEn: to put something somewhere
words.defineVi: để đặt một cái gì đó ở đâu đó

examples: The dark clouds signaled that rain was on its way.

The clock struck eleven times, signaling the start of the event.
She holds her finger to her lips, signaling for silence.
The interneurons in the spinal cord help to relay signals from sensory neurons to motor neurons, allowing for coordinated movements.
words.defineEn: to give someone a message, instruction, etc. by making a sound or movement
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho ai đó một tin nhắn, hướng dẫn, v.v. bằng cách tạo ra âm thanh hoặc chuyển động

examples: Your boat was sunk by a swordfish?
He sank his teeth into an apple.
My heart sank when I saw the pained expression on her face.
I'm not sinking any more money into it now!
He sank back on his pillow and fell into a brown study.
words.defineEn: to go under in a liquid
words.defineVi: để đi dưới trong một chất lỏng

examples: Louise went back to work feeling rather out of sorts.

All is grist that comes to the mill, he would tell his employees, as they sorted through piles of discarded items.
words.defineEn: to orderly put things in groups; to separate things based on their type
words.defineVi: để đặt mọi thứ theo nhóm một cách có trật tự; để tách những thứ dựa trên loại của họ

examples: Newborns are capable of sweating, snoring, and sneezing, but they can't shiver.

(Andy snoring)
(Andy snoring)

Three of the dogs, Casey, Dodger, and Zoey, sniffed out the odor associated with seizure with 100% accuracy.

examples: She dipped her carrot sticks into the hummus.
she gets on the stick very quickly.

words.defineEn: to fix an object to another, usually with glue or another similar substance

examples: The store sometimes offers discounts on certain items.

She stored canned goods and snacks in the kitchen pantry.
She stored homemade sauce in a glass bottle.
words.defineEn: to keep something somewhere for later use
words.defineVi: để giữ một cái gì đó ở đâu đó để sử dụng sau này

examples: Am I summarizing that properly, Erin?

And then long after Stanton's death gives a speech at Kenyon, sort of summarizing Stanton's contributions.
words.defineEn: to provide a statement of the important and main facts of something

examples: Take enough supplies.

The food supply proved to be the nation's Achilles' heel in its defense against terrorist attacks.
words.defineEn: to provide what is wanted or needed for someone or something
words.defineVi: để cung cấp những gì là muốn hoặc cần thiết cho một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: But I survived because I had faith in my cause.

My goodness, that cat survived being hit by a car!
Morin's book is a helpful guide to surviving the first few months in harness.
He was trying to survive on the road and failing.
words.defineEn: to stay alive or continue to exist, particularly after an unpleasant event
words.defineVi: để sống sót hoặc tiếp tục tồn tại, đặc biệt là sau một sự kiện khó chịu

examples: She reached blindly for the light switch.
This store is famous for its bait and switch tactics.

The students played a trick on their teacher by switching the labels on the chemical bottles.
I had to feel about in the dark for the light switch.
words.defineEn: to change from one thing to another
words.defineVi: thay đổi từ thứ này sang thứ khác

examples: She tends to rub people up the wrong way.

words.defineEn: to be likely to become something or to happen in a certain way because it is so most of the time

examples: So, Muslim scholars translated hundreds of thousands of manuscripts from Greek, Roman, Persian, Indian, and Egyptian scientists into Arabic.

words.defineEn: to carefully look at something

words.defineEn: to unexpectedly open one's mouth wide and deeply breathe in because of being bored or tired

examples: The water feels warm.

It's quite warm outside.
The afternoon sun casts a warm glow on the buildings and trees.
The season of summer brings warm weather and longer days.
words.defineEn: to make someone or something warm
words.defineVi: để làm cho một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó ấm áp

examples: The security expert warned the business owner that a bad padlock invites a picklock.
The teacher's stern grimace warned the students to behave.

words.defineEn: to tell someone about a possible danger or problem in order to prevent harm or damage
words.defineVi: để nói với ai đó về một mối nguy hiểm hoặc vấn đề có thể xảy ra để ngăn chặn tác hại hoặc thiệt hại

examples: Recycling waste saves energy.
This guy is a waste of skin!

This is your fault, you waste of skin!
The agent counsels them obliquely against waste, repeats the letter of the law, and smiles.
words.defineEn: to use something without care or more than needed
words.defineVi: để sử dụng một cái gì đó mà không quan tâm hoặc nhiều hơn mức cần thiết

examples: The passengers waved goodbye to their loved ones from the ship's deck.
The waves drove against the shore.
Well, you can wave goodbye to your brand new car, mister!
The sound of waves breaking on the beach.
The politician is riding on the wave of public support, with high approval ratings and successful campaigns.
words.defineEn: to raise one's hand and move it from side to side to greet someone or attract their attention
words.defineVi: giơ tay và di chuyển nó từ bên này sang bên kia để chào ai đó hoặc thu hút sự chú ý của họ

examples: Wonders never cease!
Wonders never cease!
Will wonders ever cease?
Would wonders ever cease?
Would wonders never cease?!
words.defineEn: to want to know about something particular
words.defineVi: muốn biết về một cái gì đó cụ thể

examples: He paused, took a step back, and remembered to be swift to hear and slow to speak.

Pause the video!
Like always, pause the video.
In unfavorable conditions, female kangaroos can pause their pregnancies.
words.defineEn: to briefly stop a process before carrying on
words.defineVi: để dừng một thời gian ngắn một quá trình trước khi tiếp tục

examples: I handed in my notice yesterday.
She noticed a small bird nesting on the roof of her garage.
He noticed a spider crawling up the wall.
Did you notice the way he was looking at you?
She noticed a difference in taste and texture when she switched to unbleached flour in her cookie recipe.
words.defineEn: to become aware of something or someone
words.defineVi: để trở thành nhận thức của một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: The bank raised interest rates.

words.defineEn: to make the intensity, level, or amount of something increase
words.defineVi: để làm cho cường độ, mức độ, hoặc số lượng của một cái gì đó tăng lên

examples: The reporter asked the politician a ridiculous question about building a tunnel to the moon, and the politician responded with some nonsense about pink elephants.

I need a minute to think about your question before I respond.
